docs.snippet: Billionaire environmental activist Tom Steyer is expanding his political agenda beyond climate change to embrace issues ranging from immigration to income inequality, which he expects will be critical to mustering votes for Democrat Hillary Clinto...
docs.lead_paragraph: Billionaire environmental activist Tom Steyer is expanding his political agenda beyond climate change to embrace issues ranging from immigration to income inequality, which he expects will be critical to mustering votes for Democrat Hillary Clinton in the November presidential election.

headline.main: Activist Steyer Expands Agenda in Bid to Defeat 'Dangerous' Trump
headline.print_headline: Activist Steyer Expands Agenda in Bid to Defeat 'Dangerous' Trump

docs.snippet: In the Democratic and Republican platforms, there’s been no battle cry over what we eat. But maybe it’s just a matter of time....
docs.lead_paragraph: In the Democratic and Republican platforms, there’s been no battle cry over what we eat. But maybe it’s just a matter of time.
docs.abstract: Collaborative political campaign Plate of the Union has been striving to make food issues priority of lawmakers and current presidential candidates by delivering its message at luncheons, party conventions and other events; bipartisan poll indicates food, and its implications for immigration, environment, healthcare and national security, is concern of all voters, and unifying force that remains untapped by politicians.

headline.main: When Will Food Issues Be on Politicians’ Plates?
headline.print_headline: Putting Food Issues on Politicians’ Plates

docs.snippet: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump "will not be releasing" his tax returns due to a federal audit, his campaign manager said on Wednesday, despite pressure to release them and provide a window into his finances before the Nov. 8 electi...
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump "will not be releasing" his tax returns due to a federal audit, his campaign manager said on Wednesday, despite pressure to release them and provide a window into his finances before the Nov. 8 election.

headline.main: No Plans to Release Tax Returns as Pressure Mounts, Trump Aide Says
headline.print_headline: No Plans to Release Tax Returns as Pressure Mounts, Trump Aide Says

docs.snippet: American intelligence agencies cautioned that they are uncertain whether the breach was an effort to manipulate the 2016 presidential election....
docs.lead_paragraph: American intelligence agencies cautioned that they are uncertain whether the breach was an effort to manipulate the 2016 presidential election.
docs.abstract: American intelligence agencies say they have 'high confidence' that Russian government orchestrated theft of emails and documents from Democratic National Committee, but are uncertain whether theft was routine cyberespionage or attempt to sway results of 2016 election; revelation presents Obama administration with difficult decision over whether to publicly accuse Russia of engineering hacking.

headline.main: Spy Agency Consensus Grows That Russia Hacked D.N.C.
headline.print_headline: Spy Agency Consensus Grows That Russia Hacked D.N.C.

byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Eric Schmitt from Colorado Springs. Amy Chozick contributed reporting from Philadelphia.
byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and ERIC SCHMITT
